branch-5-4-stable.commit_message: The real 5.4.9 release including one last fix (previous commit)

Ignore columnheader requests for array data or pseudodata

This reverts/repairs earlier commits 2837a84d 67bc1b27
(right fix but placed too early in the code)

Bugs #2585 #2648
Update Release Notes and version date for 5.4.9

spiderplot:  default fill pattern should come from "set style spiderplot"

but instead it was taken from "set style fill".

Prevent integer overflow in clipping polygon to plot bounds

If a vertex of the polygon is very far out of bounds, the interpolation
routine intersect_polyedge_with_boundary() could return an incorrect
result due to integer overflow/wraparound.
Now we cast to (double) for this calculation.
Merge branch 'qt6' into branch-5-4-stable
cairo terminals: ignore zero-size polygons
(fixup)  NEWS PATCHLEVEL configure.ac version.c  8->9

post: handle RGBA images (only current use is to render a pixmap)

Since PostScript does not support transparency, gnuplot uses the
"with rgbalpha pixels" pixel-by-pixel emulation to handle the alpha
channel in images.  However pixmaps may have an alpha channel and
they bypass the general image processing by calling term->image()
directly.  This meant that the postscript terminal driver was getting
image data in mode IC_RGBA, which it did not support. Now it throws
away the alpha channel and treats the image as if it used mode IC_RGB.

Bug #2644

configure:   Check for Qt6, fall back to Qt5

Note: requires C++  -std=c++17

Note: requires Qt6 compatibility module Core5Compat
	for class QTextCodec
		codecForLocale() codecForMib() fromUnicode() toUnicode()
	in order to support non-utf8 encodings (gnuplot's "set encoding").

	This is not entirely satisfactory, since there is apparently not
	a guarantee from Qt that the compatibility modules will continue
	to be available in the future.

./configure --with-qt=qt4  is still accepted but I no longer have
the Qt4 libraries installed to confirm that it works.

configure:   Check for Qt6, fall back to Qt5

Note: requires C++  -std=c++17

Note: requires Qt6 compatibility module Core5Compat
	for class QTextCodec
		codecForLocale() codecForMib() fromUnicode() toUnicode()
	in order to support non-utf8 encodings (gnuplot's "set encoding").

	This is not entirely satisfactory, since there is apparently not
	a guarantee from Qt that the compatibility modules will continue
	to be available in the future.

./configure --with-qt=qt4  is still accepted but I no longer have
the Qt4 libraries installed to confirm that it works.
docs: clarify "matrix every"

wxt: fix uninitialized toggle state for refresh of plot display

2nd try

Do not attempt to draw empty (no vertex) polygons

In particular do not try to store style information in the first
slot of a zero-length array of vertices.

Fix y axis autoscaling of "with yerrorbars" "with yerrorlines"

Only autoscale y for data points within the already validated x range.
This was a regression between 5.4.3 and 5.4.4

Bug #2631

plugin / import mechanism: add a version check on import

The DATA_TYPES and structure definition in gnuplot_plugin.h must
match those in gp_types.h.  It says that right in the source, but
in version 5.4 they no longer match.  This is bad.

Bring them back into sync now and add a version check mechanism to warn
if you try to import a module built for a different gnuplot version.
gnuplot_plugin.h now provides a "double gnuplot_version()" entry point.

Bug #2629

prevent segfault if GNUPLOT_DRIVER_DIR is invalid

A segfault was triggered in int_warn() if gp_input_line is NULL,
which could happen if the error occured prior to first successful
terminal initialization.
	bash$ GNUPLOT_DRIVER_DIR="foo" ./gnuplot

Release 5.4.8

Version reporting in the Windows binaries for 5.4.7 was incorrect
(it reported PATCHLEVEL 7alpha).
Rather than letting the generic source distribution get out of sync with
the binaries, the version has been bumped to 5.4.8 in both.
There are no other changes between patchlevels 7 and 8.
Release 5.4.7
prepare for release 5.4.7

Convert all calls of egrep/fgrep to grep -E / grep -F, respectively

(backport from v6)
Avoids warnings from "make" with GNU grep 3.8

consolidate 2D and 3D windows-specific test for aspect ratio

remove conditional code from graphics.c and graph3d.c in favor
of a single site in gadgets.c:effective_aspect_ratio().

windows terminal:  fix aspect ratio used to draw arrows
When drawing an arrow specified as length + angle it is necessary to
correct the length as affected by the  aspect ratio  (different scales
on x and y axes).  The windows terminal always used aspect = 1.
Now we recalculate the current aspect ratio whenever drawing an arrow.

Bug #2565

Do not warn if XDG directories cannot be opened because $HOME is not defined

If enviromental variable HOME is not set, which might be the case when
running a script anonymously for example from a cgi script, the program warns
     warning: HOME not set - cannot expand tilde
when looking for XDG configuration directories.  The warning is pointless,
and it is potentially harmful to continue a perhaps create a file somewhere
else instead.  Now we simply fail the XDG lookup silently.

Bug #2623

Fix missing key titles from 'autotitle columnhead' and 'using col("key")'

The specific combination of selecting columns in a using specifier by
providing the columnhead string together with "set key autotitle columnhead"
failed to use the columnhead string also as a title in the plot key.

Bug #2620

tweak pm3d.dem to exercise recent bugfix code

Commit 9a86acf0 fixed incorrenct handling of pm3d option "at b"
when combined with depthorder and/or interpolation.
These problems were not caught by "make check" or comparison testing
of the demo output because they were not present in any of the demos.

bugfix: combination of pm3d options "at b" or "at t" with "depthorder"

Since the introduction of smooth z-clipping in version 5.4, pm3d quadrangles
drawn on the base plane always got clipped out of existence during depthorder
processing because the flag intended to protect them is always zero in this
case.

Now we instead use (quadrangle.corner[0].z == base_z) as a test for a base
quadrangle rather then trying to check the flag.  So the base plane is
drawn, but it remains a limitation that the component quadrangles cannot be
smoothly clipped against the original z limits.

This commit also fixes an oversight that if pm3d interpolation was active,
pm3d depth sorting placed components of both the top and bottom planes on
the surface instead of at base_z or ceiling_z.

ignore datafile separator when plotting from an array

array A = [1, 2, 3]
array B = ["A", "B", "C"]
set datafile sep ";"
plot A using 1:2 with points, B using 1:1:2 with labels

Bugfix

Report cardinality |A| = 0 for an empty array

So far as I know there is nothing useful you can do with an empty
array in version 5.4 but if you have one, it now correctly identifies
as size 0.

Bug #2616
docs:  modify prolog for use with texlive2023

tikz: in standalone mode, autodetect pdflatex/lualatex/xelatex

Bug #2613

epslatex/cairolatex: Prevent redundant text in opaque textboxes

These terminals do background fill at the same time as writing the
text, so the generic operation to rewrite the text after filling
produces a second copy.  Futhermore imperfect alignment can cause
the duplicate text to look blurry.

"plot with table" must skip all smoothing operations

"plot with table" processes the using specifiers and prints the
result for each column without storing it anywhere for further use.
Anything that might try to access stored data, including filter
operations, must therefore be skipped.  This commit adds an early
check for plot style "table" and jumps to the end of processing
immediately after the tabulation output.

Bug #2610
typos

wxt:  failure to initialize coords of polygon as key sample

No current plot styles place a polygon in the key, so this is
a proactive fix (but needed in version 6).

wxt: fontscale and fontsize handling was inconsistent

1) font size was for unknown reasons limited to integer values
2) font scale applied at the level of enhanced code tracking,
   so the "noenhanced" attribute disabled the scaling
3) font scale was applied in two separate places and unapplied
   in another.  This could lead to different bits of text being
   scaled by 0, 1, or even 2 applications of the scale factor.

Bug #2373

plots using data pulled from an array must ignore "set datafile columnheader"

See also commit 67bc1b278
Bug #2585
qt: Qt::MidButton has been deprecated in favor of Qt::MiddleButton

yerrorbars: make error bar key sample match the style in the plot

Bug #2598

Handle nonlinear axes during contour generation

(backport from 6.1)

The contour code dates back to before we switched to storing the true
coordinate values of log-scale data.  It "normalizes" the contour
segments by scaling them relative to |xmax-xmin| and |ymax-ymin|.
But this makes no sense any more for log-scale data.

For the default "set cntrparam linear", this makes a difference only
in deciding whether two points are so close together that there is no
need to draw a line between them.  This logic was in fuzzy_equal(),
which we now rewrite to handle nonlinear axes.  The bug reported was
that all contours in region of the low end of the log axis were not drawn.

Bug #2593

Bugfix: empty last field of a csv file incorrectly handled

If the final character on a line of a csv file is a field separator,
that field is marked as "missing".  However some string handling routines
did not check for the "missing" flag and as a consequence re-cycled an
previous string value, possibly leading to use-after-free errors.

Now we both clear df_column[].position, which pointed to the previous
string, and in general (df_parse_string_field()) substitute a new blank
string in place of a missing string.

docs:   prevent latex error/warnings

don't warn about pdf version 1.7
don't warn about multiple pdf figures on a single page

Restore possibility to plot ... smooth acsplines with filledcurves

This combination somehow got lost in the transition 5.2 -> 5.4
It was later restored as part of a larger change in 5.5 but was not
fixed in 5-4 stable.

Bug #2592

Syntax accommodations for newer gcc

stricter prototypes for size of array parameters (gcc 11.1)
curly brackets for inline function "if" clause

Fix various problems related to unbounded iterations

- Ensure that an inner unbounded iteration will terminate when the
  source runs out of data, allowing the outer iteration to continue.
  Example
	plot for [i=1:2] for [j=1:*] FOO index i using j

- Allow splot to mix function plots with data plots containing
  an unbounded iteration.
  Example
	splot for [i=0:*] "whale.dat" index i, sin(x)

- Allow a single splot command to contain multiple clauses each
  with an unbounded iteration.
  Example
	splot for [i=1:*] "A" using i, for [j=1:*] "B" using j

Bug #2589

assign "plot ... title at {end|beginning}" to the KEYSAMPLE layer

This special layer exists so that interactive terminals can support
toggling a plot on/off by clicking on the title.  However the special
case of placing a title at the end or beginning rather than at a
specific coordinate failed to assign the layer.
Bump version to 5.4.7alpha while bugfixes to 5.4.6 are collected

pseudofiles '+' and '++' must ignore "set datafile columnheader"

The generated data never comes with columnheaders.
If a previous call to "set datafile" is in effect for actual
data files we must ignore it for any generated data.

This bug was being triggered by some of the standard demos.
For safety I am also modifying those demos to "unset datafile"
explicitly before exiting.  Retaining the columnheader setting
can mess up subsequent demos that don't want it, even aside
from the issue of pseudodata.

Bug #2585

wxt: versions prior to 3.0 do not support XDG

Bug #2587

docs: Fix build for Japanese documentation

Bug #2586
